p: Systemic corticosteroids (CS) are known to potently dampen immune inflammation. Like in inflammatory rheumatic diseases, CS might serve as a “bridge” to specific efficient antiviral therapy for COVID-19. Despite the common fears of the virus replication, provisional recommendations for managing excessive inflammatory response in COVID-19 include intravenous CS [ 5]. The World Health Organization (WHO), however, recommends to avoid routine administration of systemic CS for the treatment of viral pneumonia outside clinical trials [ 6].
